title: 2 things are lagging me? League of Legends and Chrome (Closing chrome fixes that issue though :P)
body:
So I've been getting some severe lag spikes from various sources... well 2 main ones... opening chrome and opening league of legends....

But anyways, it seems my resource manager is reporting anywhere between 10 (this is fine) and 180 tcp connections to 104.17.189.5 or various ip addresses of 104.17.18*.5 or 104.17.190.5 or so I've noticed so far...

This happens while the clients open... as I idle... as well as while I'm in game causing pings of anywhere between 200 and timing out an active ping command I have going to googles public dns...

In game I've seen pings as high as 22000

Well I'm only slightly tech savvy and after 2 weeks of a lack lustre effort I can't fix this ;x please help?

Edit:

Keep in mind both netstat -abn and resource manager report no image or pid names it's just - annnnnd... it's using multiple port ranges.... if I had a way of locking the port maybe that'd do it? I don't know...

But yeah I would like to get into ranked again ;x

replies.body:
First I would recommend clearing your browser cache (For chrome, 3 dots top right > More tools > Clear browsing data > Cached Images and Files). I don't know if this is involved but it's a fairly common fix.

Next I would recommend running a clean reinstall of League of Legends through the hextech repair tool (https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367-Automated-Troubleshooting-Hextech-Repair-Tool). This should clean out any extraneous League files floating around that might be causing issues.

If neither helps then submit a ticket to Player Support (https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new).
